caption:
This photograph captures a group of four women engaging in an outdoor activity in a forested area. They are dressed in casual, comfortable clothing suited for a day in nature. One of the women on the left side, wearing a floral print blouse and slacks, appears to be standing on a rocky outcropping, engaging in conversation with another woman seated to her right. This seated woman is dressed in a jacket and patterned pants, and she too is actively participating in the conversation.

In the background, slightly out of focus, another woman, dressed comfortably in a solid-colored shirt and blue pants, stands amidst lush green foliage, deeply engrossed in discussion with the fourth woman. This fourth woman, also seated, wears a distinctive, stylish, animal print blouse and dark pants. She looks attentively off towards the side, likely listening or observing something in the environment.

The setting is dense with greenery, featuring a mix of deciduous and coniferous trees, and the natural sunlight filtering through the leaves creates a vibrant, lively backdrop. The women, positioned on and amongst large rocks and surrounded by undergrowth and mature trees, seem to be enjoying each otherâ€™s company in this serene wilderness setting.
title: "Fern freaks" follow the shore of the Nissitisset River, a branch of the Nashua, in search of rare ferns, lady slippers and other wild flowers.
